titleStmt.title: A ballad intituled, Prepare ye to the plowe, to the tune, of Pepper is blacke. The Queene holdes the plow, to continew good seede. Trustie subiectes be readie to helpe if she neede.
titleStmt.author: Elderton, William, d. 1592?

publicationStmt.publisher: in Fleetestreete, by William How, for Richard Iohnes: and are to be solde at his shop, ioyning to the southwest doore of Paules Church,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Looke vp my lordes, and marke my wordes ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop, ioyning to the southwest doore of Paules Church
